availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Matthew Jouet McKinney (Trigg County attorney and Court Clerk)

body.p: Trigg County, Kentucky, attorney and county clerk. Virginia native. Married to Jane B. Watson on August 28, 1855. Father of Mary W. McKinney, Charles D. McKinney, and Jennie W. McKinney. Attorney in Trigg County in 1860. Clerk of Trigg County Court in Trigg County in 1862.

ab.bibl: Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Trigg County, District 1, p. 291. Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Trigg County, Cadiz, p. 194. Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Trigg County, Cadiz, p. 8. Kentucky Birth, Marriage and Death Records – Microfilm (1852-1910), KDLA, Roll #unknown, Trigg County Marriages, p. unknown. “Annual Report of the Auditor of Public Accounts of the State of Kentucky, for the Fiscal Year Ending October 10, 1862,” in 1863 Kentucky Documents, Legislative Document No. 24. (Frankfort, Ky.: Wm. E. Hughes, State Printer, 1863), 298-306. Find A Grave, “Matthew Jouet McKinney (December 26, 1822-March 4, 1904),” Memorial #31019196, http://findagrave.com/memorial/31019196 (accessed February 14, 2018).
